conclusion: Given inner diameter R, outer diameter 8R/3, incident angle 30Â°, calculate propagation time of light.
The radius of the inner circle is R/2.
The radius of the outer circle is 4R/3.
The distance from the center of the inner circle to the point where the light ray hits the inner circle is R/2.
The distance from the center of the outer circle to the point where the light ray hits the outer circle is 4R/3.
The distance between the two points where the light ray hits the inner and outer circles is 5R/6.
The time it takes for the light to travel this distance is 5R/6c.
The propagation time of monochromatic light in the water polo is 5R/6c.
